What is the history of AI?
The article ends with a brief examination of influential organizations and current issues facing the field. The history of AI is a history of fantasies, possibilities, demonstrations, and promise. Ever since Homer wrote of me-chanical “tripods” waiting on the gods at din-ner, imagined mechanical assistants have been a part of our culture.A (Very) Brief History of Artificial Intelligence - SMUs2.smu.edu
When was artificial intelligence invented?
It was demonstrated at the 1956 Dartmouth conference on artificial intelligence, the meeting that gave AI its name. Newell and Simon (1972) acknowledge the convincingness of Oliver Selfridge’s early demonstration of a symbol-manipulation pro-gram for pattern recognition (see Feigenbaum and Feldman ).A (Very) Brief History of Artificial Intelligence - SMUs2.smu.edu
What was the first book describing AI programs?
While early conference proceedings contain descriptions of many of these programs, the first book collecting descriptions of working AI programs was Edward Feigenbaum and Julian Feldman’s 1963 book, Computers and Thought.A (Very) Brief History of Artificial Intelligence - SMUs2.smu.edu
